default: (a) two {@filter simple weapons|items|source=phb|type=simple weapon} or (b) any {@filter simple melee weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon;melee weapon=sand} and a {@item shield|phb}
(a) {@item chain mail|PHB} or (b) {@item leather armor|PHB} and a {@item hand crossbow|PHB} with {@item crossbow bolts (20)|PHB|20 bolts}
(a) an {@item explorer's pack|PHB} or (b) {@item scholar's pack|PHB}

classFeature.name: Natural Evolution Increase
entries: Your Natural Evolution improves according to its rules.

classFeature.name: Natural Evolution Increase
entries: Your Natural Evolution improves according to its rules.

classFeature.name: Natural Evolution Increase
entries: Your Natural Evolution improves according to its rules.

classFeature.name: Summoner Bond Feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature granted by your Summoner Bond.

classFeature.name: Summoner Bond Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Summoner Bond.

classFeature.name: Summoner Bond Feature
entries: At 17th level, you gain a feature granted by your Summoner Bond.

classFeature.name: Summoning Stones
entries: Beginning at 1st level, you can turn the souls of certain monsters you kill into magical items known as Summoning Stones. This process takes two mechanical steps: Marking the creature then killing the creature to turn the creature into a summoning stone.

entries.name: Creating Summons
entries: As a bonus action, you can place your Summoner's Mark on a beast, plant, or monstrosity of size tiny to large with a CR equal to a third of your level(rounded down). You may do this three times per day. You can not mark swarms of creatures. Whenever a marked creature within 60 feet of you dies, you can use your reaction to turn the creature's body into a summoner's stone. You do not need to be the person to kill the creature. You can only have a number of summoner's stones equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). If you gain a summoner's stone if you are already at your limit you must choose to destroy one stone.

entries.name: Summoning Summons
entries: As an action, you can crush one of your summoner's stones and summon the creature inside. The creature you summon counts as a party ally and its turn is controlled by you immediately after you take your own turn. You can only summon one creature at a time. The creature is a reconstruction of the original creature that was used to make the summoner stone and has all the same features and abilities that the creature had in life with the excpetion of legendary actions the creature had. When summoned, it appears with full HP and materializes in a place you choose within 10 ft of you, or in the nearest unoccupied space. If you take the {@action Attack} action or cast a spell with a casting time of one action, your summon can't take the {@action Attack} action on the same turn. A summoned creature disappears if it is reduced to 0 HP and can't be summoned again until you complete a long rest. If you are knocked {@condition unconscious} your summon disappears and returns to being a summoner's stone. A summon can be summoned and resummoned without limits but it doesn't regain any of its hit points or other features dependent on rests until a short or long rest accordingly.

Summons can't be healed with healing spells such as {@spell healing word} or {@spell cure wounds} or magic items such as Healing potions. At level 1 you can only control 1 summoned creature at a time.

entries.name: Starting Stones
entries: At 1st level, you start with 1 summoner's stone. This summoner's stone holds a small or medium size beast of CR 1/4 or lower that can not fly or swim. You may not choose swarms.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: As a summoner, your use of magical summoning stones have given you a basic understanding of magic that you can use in combat to aid your summons in combat.

entries.name: Cantrips (0-Level Spell)
entries: At 1st level, you know two cantrips from the {@filter summoner spell list|spells|level=0|class=Summoner (NPOSS)}. At higher levels, you learn additional summoner cantrips of your choice, as shown in the Cantrip Known column of the Summoner table. When you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the summoner cantrips you know with another cantrip from the summoner spell list.

entries.name: Spells Known
entries: You know {@filter two 1st-level spells of your choice from summoner spell list|spells|level=1|class=Summoner (NPOSS)}. The Summoner table shows when you learn more Summoner spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your Summoner spells. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a summoner spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

classFeature.name: Natural Evolution
entries: Starting at 2nd level, when you level up the summons you currently have on you gain certain benefits. You add an additional hit die and increase its hit points accordingly. Whenever you gain the Ability Score Improvement class feature from the summoner class, your summons' abilities also improve. Your summons can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or it can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, your summoners can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature unless it has a stat above 20 when captured. At 6th, 12th, and 18th level you can improve the die of damage of each of your summons you have at the time you level up. For example, if you have a Giant Eagle that deals {@dice 1d6} slashing damage with its claws it improves to {@dice 2d6}. If you capture a new summon that is one CR below your current maximum CR it gains all ability score increases and damage increases that start from the level where there CR becomes available.

classFeature.name: Artificial Evolution
entries: At 2nd level, you gain 2 Evolution Points which you can spend on Artificial Evolutions. Artificial evolutions are abilities, powers, and upgrades you can purchase with evolution points to give to summons. Each artificial evolution applies to one summon and each summon can have a maximum of 3 artificial evolutions on it at a time. Artificial evolutions can be changed whenever the summoner gains a new level, but they are otherwise set. Evolution points cannot be saved all of the points must be spent whenever the summoner gains a level. The list of Artificial Evolutions can be found on the {@filter Optional Features page|optionalfeatures|feature type=s:ae}.

classFeature.name: Summoner Bond
entries: At 3rd level, you choose an archetype to enhance your summoning abilities. Choose Bond of the Elements, Bond of the Guardian, or Bond of the Observer, all detailed at the end of the class description. The archetype you choose grants you features at 3rd, 7th, 14th, and 17th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Improved Summoning
entries: At 10th level, you've learned to improve your skills of summoning and capturing monsters. You can now mark, capture, and summon any creature as long as it is not a humanoid. Their size is allowed to be huge now. Your summons' attacks are now counted as magical. You can also now summon 2 summons at once if both of their CRs combined does not exceed half your level rounded up. For example, at level 10 you can summon two summons if their combined CRs don't exceed 5. Both summons go immediately after you with the one with the higher Dexterity score going first.

classFeature.name: Sacrificial Pawn
entries: At 20th level, when you fall {@condition unconscious} and have at least one summon currently summoned you can remove the summon and regain it's CR in hit points. The summon can't be summoned again until your next long rest. Alternatively if your summon drops to 0 hit points you can use your reaction to remove it's CR in hit points from yourself and let it regain the same number of hit points you lost. If the summon's CR is less than 1 you gain or lose 1 hit point.

optionalfeature.name: Aerial
entries: {@b Cost: 2 Evolution Points}
A summon gains a flying speed of 20 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Aquatic
entries: {@b Cost: 2 Evolution Points}
A summon can breathe in both air and water. The summon also gains a swimming speed of 20 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Basic Magic
entries: {@b Cost: 1 Evolution Points}
A summon gain {@filter a single cantrip from the Summoner spell list|spells|level=0|class=Summoner (NPOSS)}. Constitution is its spellcasting ability when determining spellcasting modifier and DC.

optionalfeature.name: Blindsight
entries: {@b Cost: 2 Evolution Points}
A summon gains blindsight, enabling it to see 60 feet without the need for eyes. If the summon already has {@sense blindsight} it is expanded 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Climbing Speed
entries: {@b Cost: 1 Evolution Points}
A summon gains a climbing speed of 20 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Condition Immunity
entries: {@b Cost: 2 Evolution Points}

A summon gains immunity to one of the following conditions; {@condition Blinded}, {@condition Charmed}, {@condition Deafened}, {@condition Frightened}, {@condition Paralyzed}, {@condition Petrified}, {@condition Poisoned}, or {@condition Stunned}

optionalfeature.name: Darkvision
entries: {@b Cost: 1 Evolution Points}
A summon gains darkvision, enabling it to see 60 feet in darkness in shades of gray. If the summon already has darkvision it is expanded by 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Resistance
entries: {@b Cost: 3 Evolution Points}
A summon gains resistance to an elemental damage type. Choose one of the following; Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Necrotic, Poison, Psychic, Radiant, or Thunder.

optionalfeature.name: Forceful
entries: {@b Cost: 2 Evolution Points}

One of a summon's attacks is capable of knocking a foe to the ground. Pick one attack. The summon forces any foe hit by the attack to make a Strength saving equal to 8 + summon's proficiency bonus + summon's Strength modifier. On a failure, the target is knocked prone. On a success, they are unaffected.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Armor
entries: {@b Cost: 1 Evolution Points}
A summon increases its Armor Class by +1. You may choose this evolution multiple times increasing in cost by 1 evolution point each, to a total of 3.

optionalfeature.name: Keen Sense
entries: {@b Cost: 1 Evolution Points}
A summon has advantage on perception checks relying on one sense; Hearing, Sight, or Smell.

optionalfeature.name: Magic Resistance
entries: {@b Cost: 4 Evolution Points}
A summon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

optionalfeature.name: Major Magic
entries: {@b Cost: 3 Evolution Points}

A summon gains {@filter a single 2nd-level spell from the Summoner spell list|spells|level=2|class=Summoner (NPOSS)}. It can cast this spell once before requiring a long rest to cast again. Constitution is its spellcasting ability when determining spellcasting modifier and DC.

optionalfeature.name: Minor Magic
entries: {@b Cost: 2 Evolution Points}

A summon gains a single {@filter a single 1st-level spell from the Summoner spell list|spells|level=1|class=Summoner (NPOSS)}. It can cast this spell a number of times equal to its Constitution modifier. Constitution is its spellcasting ability when determining spellcasting modifier and DC.

optionalfeature.name: Mobile
entries: {@b Cost: 2 Evolution Points}
A summon gain 10 extra feet of movement.

optionalfeature.name: Mount
entries: {@b Cost: 1 Evolution Points}
A summon is properly skilled and formed to serve as a combat-trained mount. The summon must be at least one size category larger than its rider.

optionalfeature.name: Multiattack
entries: {@b Cost: 4 Evolution Points}
A summon gains the ability to attack an extra time in a turn. The attack can be made with any natural attack the summon has. If the summon already has multiattack it adds another attack to it.

optionalfeature.name: Physical Resistance
entries: {@b Cost: 4 Evolution Points}
A summon gains resistance to a physical damage type. Choose one of the following; Force, Non-Magical Bludgeoning, Non-Magical Piercing, or Non-Magical Slashing.

optionalfeature.name: Reach
entries: {@b Cost: 2 Evolution Points}

One of a summon's attacks is capable of striking at foes at a distance. Pick one attack. The summon's reach with that attack increases by 5 feet. If the attack already has reach, the range increases. This artificial evolution can be selected multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you select this artificial evolution, you pick a different attack to gain reach.

optionalfeature.name: Regeneration
entries: {@b Cost: 4 Evolution Points}

A summon regains {@dice 1d10} hit points at the start of their turn. If they take damage from magic, this trait doesn't function at the start of their next turn. The summon dies only if they starts their turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

optionalfeature.name: Resilient
entries: {@b Cost: 2 Evolution Points}
A summon gains proficiency in one saving throw of the summoner's choice.

optionalfeature.name: Skilled
entries: {@b Cost: 1 Evolution Points}
A summon gains proficiency in one skill of the summoner's choice.

optionalfeature.name: Subterranean
entries: {@b Cost: 3 Evolution Points}
A summon gains a burrowing speed of 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Tremorsense
entries: {@b Cost: 2 Evolution Points}
A summon gains tremorsense, enabling it to feel the movement of the earth up to 30 feet. If the summon already has tremorsense it is expanded by 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Truesight
entries: {@b Cost: 2 Evolution Points}
A summon gains truesight, enabling it to see into the astral sea up to 30 feet. If the summon already has truesight it is expanded by 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Venom
entries: {@b Cost: 2 Evolution Points}

One of a summon's attacks becomes venomous. Pick one attack. The summon forces any foe hit by this attack to make a Constitution saving throw equal to 8 + summon's proficiency bonus + summon's Constitution modifier. On a failure, they take {@dice 1d6} poison damage. On a success, they are unaffected. If the summon already deals poison damage then they add {@dice 1d6} to the damage. This artificial evolution can be selected multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you select this artificial evolution, you pick a different attack to gain venom.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Guardian
entries: Guardians are those who defend the weak from threats to dangerous to defend themselves from. Summoners of the bond of the guardian turn their summons into such being. You develop powerful summons to act as towers of defense for yourself and your allies.

subclassFeature.name: Beastial Bulwark
entries: {@i (3rd-level Bond of the Guardian feature)}

Starting at 3rd level, your summons are designed to defend you. Your summons gain proficiency in Constitution saving throws and a Constitution score equal to their original Constitution score + your Wisdom modifier (minimum of +1). For example, a giant eagle summon with a Constitution of 13 and its Summoner with a Wisdom of 15 will have its Constitution score become 15.

The summons HP increases accordingly to the changes to their Constitution modifier because a monster's Constitution modifier also affects the number of hit points it has. Its Constitution modifier is multiplied by the number of Hit Dice it possesses, and the result is added to its hit points. For example, if a monster has a Constitution of 13(+1 modifier) and {@dice 2d8} Hit Dice, it has {@dice 2d8 + 2} hit points (average 11).

subclassFeature.name: Summoner's Armor
entries: {@i (3rd-level Bond of the Guardian feature)}
At 3rd level, if your summon does not have any form of armor(natural or unnatural) it's AC increases to 13 + your summon's Dexterity score.

subclassFeature.name: Tower Aura
entries: {@i (7th-level Bond of the Guardian feature)}

At 7th level, your summons exude an aura of protection which you and your allies benefit from. All allies within 5 feet of your summons have advantage on Constitution saving throws and concentration checks. If you have two summons present you have to pick one to give of the Tower Aura. The other produces no aura. At 17th level, this aura increases to 10 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Shield of Scales
entries: {@i (14th-level Bond of the Guardian feature)}

At 14th level, your summons specialize in protecting those around it. Your summons can use their reaction to impose disadvantage on any non-spell attack roll that targets them or an ally with 5 feet of them.

subclassFeature.name: Titan's Might
entries: {@i (17th-level Bond of the Guardian feature)}

Starting at 17th level, your summons' abilities to protect others and take hits have given it mighty resistances. your summons gain resistance to all forms of bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Observer
entries: Using their summons as spies to watch the enemy from a far. The bond of the observer uses their summons to aid them in spying, stealing, and sneaking in the world. You specialize intrugue and stealth and use your summons to aid you in your venture.

subclassFeature.name: Summon's Proficiencies
entries: {@i (3rd-level Bond of the Observer feature)}
Starting at 3rd level, all your summons gain proficiency in {@skill Perception}, {@skill Sleight of Hand} and {@skill Stealth}.

subclassFeature.name: Third Eye
entries: {@i (3rd-level Bond of the Observer feature)}

At 3rd level, as long as your summon is within 100 feet of you, you can communicate with it telepathically and see through their senses. As an action, you can see through your summon's eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses that the summon has. During this time, you are {@condition deafened||deaf} and {@condition blinded||blind} with regard to your own senses.

subclassFeature.name: Tread Cautiously
entries: {@i (3rd-level Bond of the Observer feature)}

At 3rd level, your summons can temporarily become {@condition invisible}. As a bonus action, your summon can magically turn {@condition invisible} until the start of its next turn or until your summon attacks, makes a damage roll, or forces someone to make a saving throw. They can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Trackless Aura
entries: {@i (7th-level Bond of the Observer feature)}

At 7th level, your summons exude an aura of shadows which you and your allies benefit from. All allies within 5 feet of your summons have advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks and Dexterity saving throws. If you have two summons present you have to pick one to give off the Trackless Aura. The other produces no aura. At 17th level, this aura increases to 10 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Hidden Agent
entries: {@i (14th-level Bond of the Observer feature)}

Starting at 14th level, your summons can use the Tread Cautiously feature a number of times as your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all uses of Hidden Agent after finishing a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Surprise Attack
entries: {@i (14th-level Bond of the Observer feature)}
At 14th level, your summons are adept at surprising enemies in combat. Whenever your summons have advantage on an attack roll they can add an extra {@dice 2d6} damage to the damage roll.

subclassFeature.name: Invisibility
entries: {@i (17th-level Bond of the Observer feature)}

At 17th level, whenever your summons use their Tread Cautiously or Hidden Agent ability the invisibility lasts for 1 minute. It is still dispelled when your summon attacks, makes a damage roll, or forces someone to make a saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of Souls
entries: Summoners can't control the powerful souls of humanoids. But if undead they are weak enough to control. Summoners of the Bond of Souls focus on weakening the souls of their summons to better control them and use them in combat.

subclassFeature.name: Undead Summons
entries: Starting at 3rd level, the weakening of your summons' souls weaken their bodies. All your summons gain the Undead Fortitude feature.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces your summon to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the summon drops to 1 hit point instead.

subclassFeature.name: Necromancer
entries: {@i (3rd-level Bond of the Souls feature)}

At 3rd level, you can mark, capture, and summon Undead and Humanoids. Any humanoids you capture and summon will appear as a zombie version of themselves but will use their original statblock with excpetions of their creature type changing to Undead and their Intelligence score become 3 + their Intelligence modifier they had in life. If they used Intelligence as their spellcasting ability, the bonus they get is 3 + double their Intelligence modifier they had in life.

subclassFeature.name: Undead Bestiary
entries: {@i (7th-level Bond of the Souls feature)}
Starting at 7th level, you can decide the type of undead your summons appear as. At the end of a long rest you can choose to either have all your summons as Shadow, Skeletal or Zombified.

entries.name: Shadow
entries: Summons that are shadows can hide as a bonus action and can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing

entries.name: Skeletal
entries: Summons that are skeletal are immune to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition.

entries.name: Zombified
entries: Summons that are zombified have advantage on Constitution saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Necrosis
entries: {@i (14th-level Bond of the Souls feature)}
At 14th level, your summons have become powerful and their bodies of bone have given them resistant to necrotic damage and are immune to the effects of {@condition exhaustion}.

subclassFeature.name: Fallen Army
entries: {@i (17th-level Bond of the Souls feature)}

At 17th level, your summons' nature spreads like an infectious virus. When ever your summons kill a humanoid it rises from the dead into temporary service of you. It uses the stat block of {@creature zombie|MM} and it keeps its place in the initiative order if you were in combat. The zombie remains in your service for a number of rounds equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). You can only have one zombie at a time, if your summon kills another humanoid the zombie returns to a corpse.

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Elements
entries: On the edge of existence there lies worlds made of the primal energy of the universe. Those who practice the Bond of the Elements specialize in the overwhelming powers of these realms and the primal titans from them. You combine the elements with power of your summoned creatures to create the most dangerous threats on the battlefield.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: {@i (3rd-level Bond of the Elements feature)}

Starting at 3rd level, you can speak, read, and write one of the following; Auran, Aquan, Ignan or Terran. You also gain proficiency in one of the following; {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Religion}.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Strike
entries: {@i (3rd-level Bond of the Elements feature)}

At 3rd level, your summons gain the ability to infuse their weapon strikes with elemental energy. Once on each of your summon's turns when they hit a creature with a melee attack they deal an extra {@dice 1d8} damage to the target. You can choose the damage to be one of the following damage types: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder. You can pick which damage type at the end of a long rest and can't change until your next long rest.
At 7th level, the die increases to a {@dice 1d10}, at 15th level, {@dice 1d12}.

subclassFeature.name: Primal Sacrifice
entries: {@i (7th-level Bond of the Elements feature)}

At 7th level, when your summons drop to 0 hit points they create an explosion of elemental damage of the type of you chose for your elemental strike. All creatures within 10 feet must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + summon's CR). On a failure, they take {@dice 1d10} + your summoner level in damage of the same type you chose for their elemental strike. On a success, they take half damage.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Resistance
entries: {@i (14th-level Bond of the Elements feature)}
At 14th level, your summons have adapted to the use of the elements in their attacks and gain resistance to the damage type you currently chose as their Elemental Strike.

subclassFeature.name: Final Bow
entries: {@i (17th-level Bond of the Elements feature)}

At 17th level, whenever you de-summon a summon you can choose to activate the primal sacrifice feature even if they did not drop to 0 hit points. You can only do this one time per summon with each having to wait until a long rest to use this feature again. If the summon drops to 0 hit points it can still use Primal Sacrifice if it already used it with Final Bow.

entries.name: The Summoner
entries: A young man in fine clothes waits inside his carriage as he watches the armed bandits slowly approach his rider. He pulls a runic stone out of his pocket and tosses it out of the window. In the air the runes on the stone glow a dark red and upon impact with the ground the stone burst with red arcane energy. Standing where the stone landed is a large threeheaded chimera that releases a frightful roar from all of it's heads.

entries.name: Binders of Beasts
entries: Summoners are those who binds the beasts who would be a danger to themselves and use them as allies in battle to use them as dangers to their foes. These summons act as both faithful friends and ever-loyal servants to their master. These summoned creatures may act upon their own will, though that of the summoner takes more precedence, as they are magically compelled to follow the summoner's desires.

entries.name: Creating a Summoner
entries: When creating your Summoner think about why your characters chooses to specializes in summoning. Do they enjoy the company of animals and keeps them as pet? Or do they see them as slaves only good for certain purposes? Do you like the creatures you summon? How do you react to the creatures you summon?

It's important to work with your DM to better understand your relationship to the character and its summons. Are you their leader? Or are you some strange being to them as well, one that they must simply follow?

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a summoner quickly by following these suggestions. First, make Wisdom your highest ability score, followed by either Strength or Dexterity. Second, choose the {@background Hermit} or {@background Outlander} background. Third, choose the {@spell Mage Hand} and {@spell Fire Bolt} cantrips, along with the 1st level spells; {@spell Feather Fall} and {@spell Mage Armor}.
